definition[0]: used to say that even though you accept that something is true, it does not change a situation
example[0]: ‘He was only joking.’ ‘Be that as it may, silly remarks like that can do a lot of harm.’
definition[1]: in spite of what you have just mentioned
example[1]: Perhaps there isn’t one single system that will work for everyone. Be that as it may, we all need order in our lives.
